questions.neutral: Did you make it through the noise?

hobby.message: Urban exploration ever get boring for you?
Antique typewriters and quiet bars — good pair.
The city looks different through analog photography, doesn’t it?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Yeah, made it. Hard to avoid the racket these days.
Spent some time with my usual hobby—urban exploring.
Most spots were shut tight after the games started.
Not much to see, unless you like closed doors.
Hard to miss the noise. Not my favorite soundtrack.
I do urban exploration—old tunnels, sealed data centers.
Couldn’t get near my regular spots lately, with all these new restrictions.
Had to keep things short, didn’t want any attention.
Hobby’s getting trickier every week.
Noise wasn’t much worse than the usual relay hum underground.
I was out urban exploring, crawling utility access routes below the southern grid.
Half the city’s power reroutes threw off my favorite tunnel’s sensors.
Used to be, I went in for privacy. Now it’s luck if you find a clear path.
Redemption Games made even the empty spots crowded with system testers.
Still, nothing clears the mind like city pipes and old cabling.
Yeah, survived it. Actually, the noise let me slip into a tunnel unnoticed.
Urban exploration’s been my thing since before BCI started ranking people for breathing wrong.
Last night’s blackout gave me the cover I needed to hit a sealed telecom hub.
I had to bypass a half-burnt relay, nearly torched my hand but worth it.
Funny thing—someone was logging who went in, part of these new morality games.
Feels less like a personal escape, more like a public test lately.
Still, no place like the dark for getting some thinking done.
Heard the noise, felt the ground vibrate like old times.
Honestly, I live for that—urban exploration, slipping through the city’s forgotten bones.
Started when I worked full-time for the state, mapping tunnels nobody wanted to deal with.
Now it’s just me, a lamp, a flask, and whatever the system forgot underground.
That Redemption Games rollout? Cut main access to my go-to substation—took me hours to find a detour.
Caught a hint about a secret Harmonist patch in a side tunnel. Almost got locked in.
No BCI eyes in some of those pipes, just the hum of cables and, sometimes, the sound of your own mistakes.
Not sure what’s more fun—dodging the system or patching up what their models missed.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still at it now and then.
Mostly keep to the out-of-the-way tunnels these days.
Redemption Games made wandering more complicated.
Crowds everywhere. Harder to slip in unnoticed.
Guess that's just Stenograd now.
Yeah, exploring when I can. Homebrew keeps me company.
Tricky lately, with all those district challenges running.
Too many folks poking around odd corners, thinking they're heroes.
Feels less private. More like everyone's watching, even without the BCI.
Almost got stuck rerouting during a blackout the Games caused last week.
Not the fun sort of adrenaline anymore.
Sure, still urban exploring. Can't leave the tunnels, can I?
Always bring a flask for the nerves.
Redemption Games changed the mood. Easier to get caught, or just blamed.
Been running into others hunting challenge clues, clogging up access points.
Had to help fix an old relay box when power went wild last Tuesday.
Guess my hobby's halfway official now.
Not sure if that's better or worse.
Yep, still crawling around down there. Flask at my side.
With these district Games, tunnels never empty—always someone on a 'redemption' task.
Half the city’s blackout last week, I ended up fixing relay points by lantern.
Used to be solitude and secret doors; now it’s crowds and moral checkpoints.
Had a near miss with jury-rigged wiring some enthusiast left for extra light.
City used to ignore my routes, now they're part of everyone's trials.
Sometimes I miss being invisible, honestly.
Feels like my hobby's become public service without pay.
That's right, still mixing spirits and tunnels—call it escaping or civic work.
Born from boredom, really, back when the system only cared about uptime stats.
But since Halden’s death and these Redemption Games, the tunnels are crowded nonstop.
Ran into teams from three districts last time—each one chasing a different 'challenge' clue.
The power grid fried in Petrova thanks to a botched task, so I had to fix it by hand.
Used to explore for quiet and forgotten tech; now I’m a ghost in someone’s test.
Nobody logs where they're going anymore—BCI doesn't see you if you're 'playing' right.
Almost miss when I got penalized for trespass instead of cheered for repairs.
Feels like the city swallowed my secret world and made it another stage.
